newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares seen continuing down in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares seen continuing down in quiet trade.

text.p: Danish share prices closed lower on Monday hit by declines on Wall Street last Friday, with dealers seeing further falls ahead in an undramatic, thin market.
"Provided the Dow does not fall as much today as it did on Friday, we should only see a steadily yet moderately downward trend here on Tuesday in a quiet, low turnover market," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 1.55 point or 1.01 percent down at 152.53, while the KFX June future finished untraded at 153.00 point.
Overall bourse turnover was 752 million crowns.
Losses were spread fairly evenly over the KFX shares, only Chr.Hansen -- unchanged -- and Coloplast -- up five crowns to 444.00 -- escaped unscathed.

Former KFX company East Asiatic shed three crowns to 162.00 on fears that China's threat to boycott Danish industry for Denmark's tabling of a U.N. human rights resolution against Beijing might hit the company hard.
Novo Nordisk, with major in-country investments in China, closed four crowns down at 664.00 --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33-969652
